basics.name: Favour James
basics.label: Machine Learning Engineer
basics.summary: Machine Learning Engineer with research experience in NLP, LLMs, and Knowledge Graphs. Skilled in building extraction pipelines and designing evaluation frameworks for robust and efficient model performance. My work spans constructing biological knowledge graphs for scientific discovery, evaluating the robustness of multilingual LLMs to noisy inputs, and developing graph datasets for benchmarking graph neural networks.

work.name: Cytoscape Consortium
work.summary: Developing LLM-based pipelines for extracting, representing, and visualizing biological interactions as knowledge graphs in BEL format, integrated with Cytoscape Web and NDEx.
highlights: Built a production-ready Python package that transforms scientific text into structured knowledge graphs using LLMs, outputting interactions in Biological Expression Language (BEL).
Designed pipelines for converting BEL statements into Cytoscape-compatible networks and uploading to NDEx for interactive visualization of biological knowledge graphs.
Conducted expert evaluation of extracted BEL statements, highlighting strengths and weaknesses of LLM-based extraction pipelines in terms of robustness and reliability.
Benchmarked the pipeline against INDRA, demonstrating extraction of significantly more interactions from the same sentence.
Delivered a talk at ISMB/ECCB 2025 (Liverpool, UK) on LLM-driven biological knowledge graph construction.

work.name: Google Summer of Code 2024 – National Resource for Network Biology
work.summary: Developed pipelines for LLM-based molecular interaction extraction and knowledge graph creation from scientific literature.
highlights: Implemented interaction extraction pipelines using GPT-4/GPT-4 Turbo via LangChain, transforming text into structured knowledge graph triples in BEL format.
Created evaluation workflows to measure robustness of extracted knowledge graphs, achieving an F1-score of 47.92% on grounded datasets.
Improved grounding of biological entities using Gilda, increasing precision by 18% in graph construction.
Benchmarked LLM-based knowledge graph extraction against traditional REACH/INDRA pipelines, showing tradeoffs in robustness and efficiency.

work.name: Google Summer of Code 2023 – National Resource for Network Biology
work.summary: Worked on biomedical graph data preprocessing and developed benchmark resources for graph neural network research.
highlights: Developed and released the BrcaTcga dataset by integrating biomedical graph data from cBIOPortal and Pathway Commons, enabling survival prediction tasks with graph-based data.
Implemented GNN models (GCNConv, GATConv) to evaluate dataset utility, achieving RMSE of 31.013 on survival prediction benchmarks.
Contributed the BrcaTcga dataset to the PyTorch Geometric official repository, supporting reproducible research on graph neural networks.

volunteer.summary: Led the Women in Engineering branch, supporting female participation in engineering activities.
Planned and coordinated events and hackathons.
Organized ML training bootcamps for students.
Supported members in preparing for and participating in competitions.
Oversaw branch activities in alignment with IEEE policies.

awards.title: ISCB Fellowship Grant Award
awards.summary: Awarded fellowship grant to attend ISMB/ECCB 2025 in Liverpool, UK.

awards.title: Poster Award
awards.summary: Recognized for outstanding poster presentation on graph neural networks.

awards.title: Best Poster Award
awards.summary: Awarded best poster at DSN-AI Bootcamp 2023.

publications.name: textToKnowledgeGraph: Generation of Molecular Interaction Knowledge Graphs Using Large Language Models for Exploration in Cytoscape
publications.summary: Introduced a tool that extracts interactions from publications directly in BEL and visualizes them in Cytoscape.

publications.name: Evaluating Robustness of LLMs to Typographical Noise in Yorùbá QA
publications.summary: Explored robustness of LLMs to noisy inputs in Yorùbá QA systems.

publications.name: A Beginner’s Guide to Structured Query Language (SQL)
publications.summary: Beginner-friendly SQL series featured on Hashnode Twitter page.

publications.name: GSoC’23 Chronicles
publications.summary: Detailed GSoC articles serving as a resource for researchers.

projects.name: DermaLog
projects.summary: An innovative application designed to assist individuals in monitoring and understanding their skin’s health over time.
highlights: Won first place for Robomua hackathon

projects.name: BrcaTcga Dataset
projects.summary: Developed and integrated into PyTorch Geometric repository, widely used for GNN benchmarking.
